review_data.title: Great Cheese, Ales and Staff
review_data.content: A gem hidden away in a food market. high quality chesses, good selection of beers and ales and lots of other british classics and must eats! Go there asap!

review_data.title: It's a small cheese shop, it's even a smaller bar
review_data.content: I was finally able to find this small bar located inside Im Viadukt that I had searched no fewer than three times previously. The closest public transports are Trams 4/13/17 stop Dammweg. As you walk into the Im Viadukt, in the center right there is...More

review_data.title: Käsemeister
review_data.content: Surprisingly few reviews…I guess as the smallest bar in Zurich, it's easy to walk past. But hard to leave. By far the biggest selection of British ales, stouts and other beery permutations in Zurich (and let's be honest, probably Switzerland). Far from a scatter-gun approach,...More

review_data.title: Great service and excellent selection of cheese
review_data.content: This is one of the few places in Switzerland, where you can taste an excellent selection of British cheese and imported ales. The service is great and staff are very knowledgable about the products. I frequently visit the stand for a bagel and always look...More

review_data.title: Great cheese platters made to order!
review_data.content: This is great - not only do they sell cheese, scones, ale, clotted cream, port, and other stuff to take home, they'll put together a fantastic cheese platter (small or large) on the spot, tailored to your tastes and to match the drink(s) you're drinking....More

review_data.title: Fantastic cheese, bagels and beer.... But best of all....the staff
review_data.content: Mike, the owner of The Mousetrap Pub in Zurich, is one of the most knowledgeable cheese men you could ever meet. This combined with his witty personality, caring manner and generosity makes the Mousetrap pub one of the best places to hang out in a...More

review_data.title: Small but not cheesy (Pun intended)
review_data.content: O.k. it is cheesy. But not that kind of cheesy. It is the real British cheese kind of cheesy. Why? Because you get Switzerland largest selection of British finest cheeses plus a really nice beer from the tap (Or from the bottle if you prefer...More
